subject: Travel
title: Why Humans Build Monuments
description: A quick, practical guide to Why Humans Build Monuments.

hook.text: Every civilization builds something massive. Pyramids, cathedrals, skyscrapers â€” the urge is universal.

buildup.text: Anthropologists say monuments serve as power displays. They say to rivals: 'We can do this.'

discovery.text: But monuments also unify communities. Building together creates shared identity and purpose.

twist.text: The Great Wall employed millions. Notre-Dame took 200 years. The project itself was the point.

climax.text: Even today, nations pour billions into landmarks that define their identity on the world stage.

punchline.text: Monuments are how civilizations say 'we were here.'

quiz.question: Besides showing power, what do monuments help create?
